CatDescriptText: George Hubbard, unemployed, 2247 Somers Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 28, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think race relations are improved, are worse, or about the same today as compared to pre-World War II years?" answer reads: "I feel that they have improved, because now we have better jobs. However, we have a long way to go."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George Hubbard wearing moustache with small goatee, dark hat, and light colored coat with single button at neck, posed in front of block building
